title: No-Bake Nut Cookies
steps: Combine brown sugar, evaporated milk, butter or margarine, and broken pecans in a heavy two-quart saucepan.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture bubbles across the surface.
Continue boiling and stirring for 5 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in vanilla.
Add shredded rice biscuits and mix thoroughly.
Using two teaspoons, drop the mixture onto wax paper to form about 30 clusters.
Let stand for approximately 30 minutes, until firm.

title: Jewell Ball's Chicken
steps: Spread 1 small jar of chipped beef, cut into pieces, over the bottom of a baking dish.
Place 4 boneless chicken breasts on top.
In a bowl, mix together 1 can cream of mushroom soup and 1 carton sour cream.
Pour the mixture evenly over the chicken.
Bake uncovered at 275°F for 3 hours.

title: Creamy Corn
ingredients: 1 package (8 oz) cream cheese cut into cubes
steps: Place 2 packages (16 oz each) frozen corn into a slow cooker
Add 1 package (8 oz) cream cheese cut into cubes
Add 1/3 cup butter cut into pieces
Add 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
Add 1/2 teaspoon salt
Add 1/4 teaspoon pepper
Cover and cook on low heat for about 4 hours
Stir before serving

title: Chicken Funny Casserole
steps: Boil 1 large whole chicken until fully cooked, then debone and cut into bite-size pieces
Place the chicken in a medium square casserole dish
Pour over 2 cans (10 1/2 oz each) chicken gravy and 1 can cream of mushroom soup, spreading evenly
Prepare 1 box (6 oz) Stove Top stuffing according to package directions, keeping it slightly dry
Spread the stuffing over the chicken mixture
Sprinkle 4 oz shredded cheese on top
Bake at 350°F for about 20 minutes, until bubbly and lightly golden

title: Reese's Cups Candy
steps: Mix together peanut butter, graham cracker crumbs, melted butter, and powdered sugar until smooth.
Press the mixture firmly into an ungreased 13 x 9-inch pan.
Melt chocolate chips and spread evenly over the top.
Refrigerate for about 20 minutes.
Cut into pieces before the chocolate fully hardens.
Store in the refrigerator.

title: Rhubarb Coffee Cake
steps: Cream together 1 1/2 cups sugar and 1/2 cup butter.
Add 1 egg and beat well.
Alternately add 1 cup buttermilk and a mixture of 2 cups flour, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1 teaspoon soda.
Mix thoroughly.
Stir in 2 cups finely chopped rhubarb and 1 teaspoon vanilla.
Pour into a greased 9 x 13-inch pan.
Add topping as desired before baking.

title: Scalloped Corn
steps: Mix together 1 can cream-style corn, 1 can whole kernel corn, about 20 crushed saltine crackers, 1 beaten egg, 2 teaspoons melted butter, and pepper to taste.
Transfer to a buttered baking dish.
Dot the top with the remaining 4 teaspoons butter.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour.

title: Millionaire Pie
steps: Empty 1 large container Cool Whip into a bowl.
Drain 1 large can crushed pineapple and mix it into the whipped topping.
Add 1 can condensed milk.
Squeeze the juice from 3 lemons, removing seeds, and stir it in.
Chop 1 cup pecans and fold into the mixture.
Pour into 2 graham cracker crusts.
Cover and chill overnight before serving.

title: Buckeye Candy
steps: Mix together 1 box powdered sugar, 8 oz soft butter, and 1 jar (8 oz) peanut butter until smooth.
Roll the mixture into small balls and place on a cookie sheet.
Freeze for at least 30 minutes.
Melt 12 oz chocolate chips together with paraffin in a double boiler.
Using a toothpick, dip each ball about three-quarters of the way into the chocolate mixture, leaving the top exposed.

title: Quick Barbecue Wings
steps: Clean chicken wings in the quantity desired.
Coat lightly with flour and fry until fully cooked.
Transfer the wings to a microwave-safe bowl.
Add barbecue sauce to taste and stir well.
Microwave on high for 4 minutes, stirring once during cooking.

title: Taco Salad Chip Dip
steps: Mix together taco sauce, sour cream, and cream cheese until smooth.
Spread the mixture onto a pizza pan.
Brown ground beef, drain excess fat, and mix with taco seasoning.
Spread the meat over the cream mixture.
Layer with shredded lettuce, diced tomato, diced onion, diced green pepper, and shredded Colby or Cheddar cheese.
Serve with chips.

title: Pink Stuff Frozen Dessert
ingredients: 1 can cherry or strawberry pie filling
steps: Mix together 1 can cherry or strawberry pie filling, 1 can crushed pineapple drained, 1 can sweetened condensed milk, 1 container (8 oz) thawed whipped topping, and 2 tablespoons lemon juice.
Pour into a 9 x 13-inch pan.
Freeze until firm.
Let stand about 15 minutes before serving.

title: Fresh Strawberry Pie
steps: Combine water, cornstarch, sugar, and salt in a saucepan.
Bring to a boil, stirring constantly, until thick and clear.
Remove from heat and stir in strawberry gelatin.
Cool slightly without letting it set.
Layer cleaned strawberries in a baked pie shell.
Pour glaze over them.
Refrigerate and serve with whipped cream.

title: Easy German Chocolate Cake
steps: Prepare 1/2 package chocolate fudge cake mix and 1/2 package white cake mix according to package directions
Add 1/4 cup Wesson oil
Pour into a 9 x 13-inch pan
Bake as directed until done

title: Broccoli Salad
steps: Trim and wash 1 large head broccoli
Cut broccoli into bite-size pieces
Add 10 slices cooked, crumbled bacon
Add 5 sliced green onions or 1/4 cup chopped red onion
Add 1/2 cup raisins
In a separate bowl, mix 1 cup mayonnaise, 2 tablespoons vinegar, and 1/4 cup sugar
Toss dressing with broccoli mixture
Refrigerate for 2 to 3 hours before serving

title: Strawberry Whatever
steps: Dissolve 1 large package strawberry gelatin in 1 1/2 cups boiling water.
Add 1 lb frozen strawberries in juice, 1 can crushed pineapple, 3 mashed ripe bananas, and 1 cup chopped pecans.
Spread half the mixture in a pan and freeze for 30 minutes.
Spread 1 pint sour cream over the top.
Add remaining mixture.
Chill until set.

title: Eggless Milkless Applesauce Cake
steps: Cream together 1/2 cup shortening and 3/4 cup sugar.
Add 1 1/2 cups applesauce, 1 cup raisins, and 1 cup nuts.
Sift together 2 cups flour, 3 teaspoons soda, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, 1 teaspoon cloves, and 1 teaspoon nutmeg, then add to the mixture.
Pour into a greased pan.
Bake at 350°F for 45 to 60 minutes.

title: Grandma Hanrath’s Banana Bread
steps: Cream 1 cup sugar and 1/2 cup shortening.
Add 2 eggs one at a time.
Stir in 1 teaspoon salt and 2 teaspoons soda.
Add 2 chopped overripe bananas.
Add 2 cups flour.
Add 1/4 cup nuts.
Mix well.
Bake in a loaf pan at 350°F for 1 hour.

title: Chocolate Frango Mints
steps: Mix together 1 package devil’s food cake mix, 1 package instant chocolate fudge pudding, 8 oz sour cream, 3/4 cup water, 1/2 cup Wesson oil, and 4 eggs.
Beat for 5 minutes, scraping bowl often.
Fold in 6 oz chopped Frango mints.
Bake at 350°F for 35 to 40 minutes.

title: Cuddy Farms Marinated Turkey
steps: Mix together 2 cups 7-Up or Sprite, 1 cup vegetable oil, 1 cup soy sauce, and garlic salt to taste.
Cut a whole turkey breast into hand-sized pieces.
Pour marinade over the meat.
Refrigerate for at least 8 hours, up to 48 hours, before cooking.

title: Spaghetti Sauce to Can
steps: Cook chopped peppers and onions in 1 cup oil for 30 minutes.
Cook 1/2 bushel tomatoes and 1/4 cup minced garlic.
Mill or process tomatoes.
Combine tomatoes with 6 cans tomato paste, 1 1/2 cups sugar, 1/2 cup salt, 1 tablespoon basil, 2 tablespoons oregano, and 1 teaspoon Italian seasoning.
Cook for 1 hour.
Seal in jars.

title: Prize-Winning Meat Loaf
steps: Mix together ground beef, tomato juice, oats, beaten egg, chopped onion, pepper, and salt.
Press the mixture into a loaf pan.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour.
Let rest 5 minutes before slicing.

title: Smothered Round Steak
steps: Dredge round steak in flour
Brown steak briefly in vegetable oil
Add chopped onions, celery, bell peppers, beef stock, salt, black pepper, white pepper, and red pepper
Cover and cook slowly over low heat until tender

title: Corral Barbecued Beef Steak Strips
steps: Brown 2 lb sliced round steak in 2 tablespoons oil.
Combine 1 can tomato sauce, 1/3 cup water, 2 tablespoons brown sugar, 1 tablespoon military, and 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce.
Add sauce and sliced onion to meat and simmer 30 minutes until tender.

title: Easy Fudge
steps: Heat 1 can sweetened condensed milk with 1 package semi-sweet chocolate chips and optional unsweetened chocolate over low heat
Stir until smooth
Remove from heat
Stir in chopped nuts and 1 teaspoon vanilla
Spread into a buttered pan

title: Taco-Filled Green Pepper
steps: Brown 1 lb ground beef
Mix ground beef with taco seasoning, kidney beans, and 1 cup salsa
Cut 4 green peppers in half and boil for 3 minutes
Fill peppers with meat mixture
Bake covered at 350°F for 15 to 20 minutes
Top with tomato, cheese, and sour cream

title: One Hour Rolls
steps: Heat 1 cup milk, 2 tablespoons sugar, 1 tablespoon salt, and 3 tablespoons oil until boiling.
Cool the mixture to lukewarm.
Add 1 package yeast and mix into 2 cups flour.
Roll the dough.
Cut the dough.
Let the dough rise for 1 hour.
Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes.

title: Punch Bowl Fruit Salad
steps: Combine 2 cans sliced peaches, 2 cans fruit cocktail, 1 can diced pineapple with juice, 1 quart strawberries, 4 bananas, and assorted apples and grapes.
Mix well
Chill before serving.

title: Summer Chicken
steps: Marinate chicken cutlets in 1/2 cup oil, 1/3 cup red vinegar, 2 tablespoons oregano, and 2 tablespoons garlic salt.
Cook as desired.

title: Cherry Pizza
steps: Spread 2 cans cherry pie filling in a greased baking pan.
Sprinkle dry white cake mix over cherries.
Top with ground nuts.
Top with melted butter.
Bake at 350°F for 45 minutes.

title: Potato and Cheese Pie
steps: Beat 3 eggs with 1 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper
Stir in 2 cups half-and-half, 3 cups shredded potatoes, 1 cup Cheddar cheese, and 1/3 cup green onions
Bake at 400°F for 35 to 40 minutes

title: Tuna Macaroni Casserole
steps: Prepare 1 box macaroni and cheese as directed
Stir in 1 can drained tuna
Stir in 1 jar pimentos
Stir in 1 chopped onion
Serve hot or cold

title: Artichoke Dip
steps: Drain and chop 2 cans artichoke hearts
Mix artichoke hearts with 1 cup mayonnaise and 1 cup Parmesan cheese
Bake uncovered at 350°F for 20 to 30 minutes

title: Broccoli Dip for Crackers
steps: Mix sour cream, dry vegetable soup mix, thawed chopped broccoli, and half of grated Cheddar cheese.
Top with remaining cheese.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.

title: Summer Spaghetti
steps: Cook 1 lb thin spaghetti
Drain the spaghetti
Toss the spaghetti with butter
Marinate the spaghetti overnight with Salad Supreme seasoning and Italian dressing
Add vegetables before serving

title: Pear-Lime Salad
steps: Drain 1 can pear halves and reserve juice.
Boil pear juice and dissolve lime gelatin in it.
Cool slightly, then mix with softened cream cheese and lemon yogurt.
Stir in pears.
Chill until set.

title: Watermelon Rind Pickles
steps: Cut watermelon rind into cubes
Parboil watermelon rind until tender
Boil sugar, vinegar, oil of cloves, and oil of cinnamon
Pour mixture over rind
Soak rind overnight
Reheat rind twice
Seal rind in jars

title: Chicken Stew
steps: Remove meat from 3 lb boiled chicken and reserve the broth.

In a large pot combine the chicken, 4 diced medium potatoes, 2 chopped onions, 1 can (16 oz) creamed corn, 1 can English peas, 1 can field peas, 1 can butter beans, 1 can tomatoes, 1 can (46 oz) tomato juice, and 1 small box macaroni.
Add 1 tablespoon salt, 1 tablespoon black pepper, and 1 tablespoon sugar.
Cook over medium heat until all vegetables are tender.

title: Angel Biscuits
steps: Mix together 5 cups flour, 3 tablespoons sugar, 4 teaspoons baking powder, and 1 teaspoon soda.
Cut in 1 1/2 sticks margarine.
Dissolve 1 1/2 packages dry yeast in 1/2 cup warm water.
Stir the dissolved yeast into 2 cups buttermilk.
Combine the wet ingredients with the dry ingredients.
Cover and chill before baking as biscuits.

title: Quick Peppermint Puffs
steps: Dip 8 marshmallows in 2 tablespoons melted margarine
Roll each marshmallow in 1/4 cup crushed peppermint candy
Wrap each marshmallow completely with crescent roll dough from 1 can
Dip each marshmallow again in margarine
Place each marshmallow in a greased muffin tin
Bake at 375°F for 10 to 15 minutes

title: Fruit Pizza
steps: Mix together yellow cake mix, water, brown sugar, soft butter, eggs, and chopped nuts.
Spread the mixture into greased pizza pans.
Bake at 350°F for 15 to 20 minutes.
Add fruit toppings after baking.

title: Chocolate Mint Bars
steps: Mix together flour, sugar, softened oleo, eggs, and chocolate syrup.
Pour into a 9 x 13-inch pan.
Bake at 350°F for 25 to 30 minutes.
Until the top springs back lightly when touched.

title: Beer Bread
steps: Stir together 3 cups self-rising flour, 1 tablespoon sugar, and 1 can (12 oz) beer.
Pour into a greased loaf pan.
Bake at 425°F for 50 minutes.
Drizzle melted butter over the top if desired.

title: Mexican Cookie Rings
steps: Sift together 1 1/2 cups flour, 1/2 teaspoon baking powder, and 1/2 teaspoon salt.
Cream 1/2 cup butter with 2/3 cup sugar.
Add 3 egg yolks and 1 teaspoon vanilla to the creamed mixture.
Mix in the dry ingredients to the creamed mixture.
Shape the dough into rings.
Dip the rings into multi-colored candies.
Bake at 375°F for 10 to 12 minutes.

title: Vegetable-Burger Soup
steps: Brown 1/2 lb ground beef lightly in a soup pot and drain excess fat.
Add 2 cups water, 1 can stewed tomatoes, 1 can tomato sauce, 1 package onion soup mix, 1 package frozen mixed vegetables, 1 teaspoon sugar.
Simmer for 20 minutes.

title: Corn Pudding
steps: Mix sugar, flour, salt, eggs, milk, melted butter, and drained corn.
Pour the mixture into a baking dish.
Bake at 375°F for 1 hour.

title: Corn Casserole
ingredients: 1 (16 oz.) container fat free sour cream
steps: Mix 1 can creamed corn, 1 can whole corn, 1 stick margarine (melted), and 1 box Jiffy corn bread mix (dry) until well combined
Stir in about 3/4 of the 1 (16 oz.) container fat free sour cream and mix well

title: Poppy Seed Bread
ingredients: 1 pkg. Betty Crocker butter pecan cake mix
steps: Mix 1 c. boiling water with 2 Tbsp. poppy seed and set aside
Mix 1 pkg. Betty Crocker butter pecan cake mix, 1 small pkg. instant coconut pudding, 1/2 c. oil, and 4 eggs
Add the seed-and-water mixture to the mixture
Pour the mixture into 2 greased loaf pans
Bake at 325° for 1 hour
Freezes well

title: Seven Layer Salad
steps: Layer lettuce
Layer tomatoes
Layer boiled eggs (cut)
Layer grated cheese
Layer 2 cans English peas (drained)
Cover with Miracle Whip mayonnaise
Sprinkle bacon bits on top
Refrigerate

title: Pizza Dippers
ingredients: 10 oz. can Pillsbury refrigerator pizza crust
steps: Grease 1 large cookie sheet
Unroll the pizza crust and cut it into 16 strips
Place strips apart on the sheet
Brush the strips with margarine
Sprinkle the strips with pizza seasonings
Bake at 350° for 11 to 17 minutes
Sprinkle with shredded Mozzarella cheese
Return to oven to melt
Serve immediately with warm pizza sauce for dipping

title: Super Sundae Pie
steps: Stir 2 pt. (1 qt.) vanilla ice cream slightly softened until smooth
Spoon into 1 (6 oz.) graham cracker pie crust and cover
Freeze several hours until hard
Then let stand 10 minutes to soften
Spoon 1 jar strawberry topping onto the serving plate
Set a slice of pie on top
Garnish with 1 bottle chocolate sundae syrup plus 1/2 c. nuts, whipped cream, and maraschino cherries as desired
Then return to freezer.

title: Cranberry-Orange Relish For Poultry
ingredients: 1 (16 oz.) can pear halves (drained and chopped)
steps: Combine all ingredients in a saucepan
Bring to a boil over medium heat
Reduce heat and simmer until thick
Cool and refrigerate

title: Garden Cabbage Salad
steps: Combine 1 small cabbage (finely shredded), 1 bunch green onions (chopped), 1 shredded carrot, 1 small green pepper (finely chopped), 6 radishes (thinly sliced), and 1 cucumber (finely chopped)
cover and chill
toss with Dressing just before serving

title: Kentucky Pecan Pie
steps: Mix white corn syrup, brown sugar, salt, melted butter, vanilla, eggs (slightly beaten), and finely chopped pecans.
Bake for 45 minutes at 350°.
Decorate with whole pecan halves.

title: London Broil
steps: Place 1 flank steak (about 1 1/2 lb.) in a shallow pan
Combine 1 c. salad oil with 1 Tbsp. vinegar and 1 clove garlic (minced) and pour over
Cover and refrigerate 3 hours or overnight turning several times
Broil 3 inches from heat about 5 minutes
Season with salt and pepper
Turn
Broil 3 minutes
Season again
Carve very thin slices diagonally across the grain
Serve 4 to 5

title: Hello Dolly Bars
steps: Melt 1 stick of Oleo
Mix with 1 c. Graham Cracker Crumbs and spread in the bottom of a greased 9 x 13-inch pan
Layer 1 c. Chocolate Chips, 1 c. Butterscotch Chips, 1 c. Walnuts chopped (optional), and 1 c. Coconut (shedded)
Pour 1 c. Condensed Milk over top
Bake at 350° for 30-35 minutes
Cool
Cut into bars

title: Macaroni And Cheese Casserole
ingredients: 1 can condensed cream of mushroom soup
steps: Mix grated sharp cheese, cooked and drained macaroni, condensed cream of mushroom soup, pimento, mayonnaise, and grated onion.
Before baking, cover with crumbled cheese crackers and dot with butter.
Bake at 325° for 40 minutes.

title: Cream Cheese Squares
steps: Mix 1 box yellow cake mix with 1 egg and 1 stick margarine
Press the mixture into a 9 x 12-inch sheet cake pan
Mix and cream together 1 box 10x sugar, 2 eggs, and 8 oz. cream cheese (softened)
Spread the mixture over the base
Bake at 350° for 40 minutes
Cut when cool

title: Beef Barbecue
steps: Put the boneless chuck roast in a pot
Add ketchup, water, mustard, lemon juice, vinegar, and finely chopped onion
Cook on low to medium heat for 3 to 4 hours
Check and add extra water and ketchup if liquid disappears

title: Cream Pie and Pudding (Microwave)
steps: Combine sugar, flour, and salt in a deep 2-quart glass bowl
Add eggs or egg yolks and milk
Beat with a whisk until smooth
Microwave at full power for 8 minutes, stirring 3 times
Proceed as the recipe directs

title: Crispix Cookies
steps: Melt 1 (12 oz.) pkg. butterscotch morsels with 1 (6 oz.) pkg. semi-sweet chocolate morsels in a large saucepan over low heat, stirring constantly until smooth
Remove from heat and add 1 1/2 c. salted peanuts and 4 c. Kellogg's Crispix cereal, stir gently until well coated
Drop by teaspoons onto waxed paper
Chill until firm

title: Rum Balls
ingredients: additional 1 c. powdered sugar for rolling
steps: Combine finely crushed vanilla wafers, finely chopped nuts, and 1/2 cup of the powdered sugar in a large bowl
Melt semi-sweet chocolate with light corn syrup
Stir in rum until smooth
Pour over the crumb mixture and mix thoroughly
Roll into 1-inch balls
Place on wax paper
Roll each ball in the remaining 1 c. powdered sugar
Store airtight for at least 3 days before serving

title: Millionaire Cake
ingredients: 1 20 oz. can crushed pineapple and juice
steps: Beat together flour, sugar, soda, eggs, coconut, nuts, vanilla, salt, crushed pineapple and juice.
Bake in a 9 x 13-inch pan at 350° for 45 to 55 minutes.

title: Hawaiian Carrots
steps: Scrape and cut 1 lb. pkg. carrots into small pieces
Cook and drain carrots and salt
Drain 1 (No. 2) can and 1 small can crushed pineapple
Cook 1/2 cup pineapple juice with 3 Tbsp. cornstarch, 1/2 stick oleo, and 1/2 c. brown sugar until thick
Add carrots and pineapple
Simmer for 10 minutes (better if made a day ahead)

title: Ginny’s Salad
steps: Wash, dry, and break red leaf lettuce into bite-size pieces
Toss lettuce with shredded Mozzarella cheese
Add chopped walnuts to the salad
Mix Good Seasons Italian dressing according to directions
Just before serving, mix the dressing with the salad

title: Fish And Broccoli Roll-Ups
steps: Cut fish into strips
Cut broccoli into small pieces
Alternate broccoli pieces and rolled fish strips onto kabob spears
Add lemon wedges to each end
Baste with salad dressing
Broil for 8 to 10 minutes

title: Fat Free Pizza Treats
steps: Top toasted English muffins with pizza sauce
Add toppings of your choice (Parmesan cheese, grated onion, sliced mushrooms, chopped green pepper)
End with 1 Tbsp. (skim) Mozzarella cheese
Toast in a toaster oven until cheese melts

title: Sesame Chicken Wings
ingredients: 2 lb. chicken wings with wing tips cut off
steps: Whisk together light soy sauce, minced garlic, minced ginger, honey, and black pepper.
Add chicken wings and toss to coat.
Marinate covered and chilled for 2 hours.
Line a pan with foil and arrange wings drained in one layer.
Brush with Oriental sesame oil.
Sprinkle with toasted sesame seed.
Bake at 400° for 30 to 35 minutes basting occasionally with the reserved marinade until browned.
Serve as an hors d'oeuvre.

title: Macaroni And Cottage Cheese
steps: Cook 3 c. uncooked macaroni until tender and drain
Mix in 1 small carton cottage cheese
Brown 1/2 stick butter in a skillet
Pour butter over the macaroni
Add salt and pepper to taste
Serve

title: Brown Ground Beef and Assemble Pie
steps: Brown ground beef with chopped onion and green onion in a large skillet
Drain fat and stir in spaghetti sauce
Combine Parmesan cheese, beaten eggs, and butter in a large bowl
Mix well and spread in the bottom of a 13 x 9-inch pan
Spread cottage cheese over top
Pour the sauce mixture over cottage cheese
Sprinkle with shredded Mozzarella cheese
Bake at 350° until cheese melts

title: Easters Hamburgers
steps: Brown hamburger patties
Slice raw onions and place on top of patties
Mix tomato sauce, dry mustard, brown sugar, salt, pepper, and chili powder
Pour the mixture over hamburgers
Bake for 1 hour at 350°

title: Coconut Macaroons
steps: Combine coconut, flour, sugar, and salt
Stir in beaten egg whites and almond extract
Mix well
Lightly grease a cookie sheet
Cut maraschino cherries into quarters
Drop batter by teaspoonfuls about 1-inch apart
Top each with a cherry
Bake at 325° for 20 to 25 minutes
Remove when edges are golden

title: Cranberry Salad
steps: Put 3 oranges, 2 apples, and 1 lb. cranberries through a food chopper
Drain a No. 2 can crushed pineapple and add it
Dissolve 2 small pkg. Jell-O plus 1 1/2 c. sugar in 2 c. water (heat to dissolve thoroughly)
Mix into the fruit mixture
Add 1 c. chopped nuts
Refrigerate about 24 hours before serving

title: Lazy Day Salad
ingredients: 1 large can crushed pineapple with juice
steps: Mix by hand 1 large can fruit cocktail (drained), 2 cans mandarin oranges (drained), 1 large can crushed pineapple with juice, 1 box instant vanilla pudding, and 1 box instant lemon pudding
Fold in 1 large container Cool Whip
Refrigerate all day or overnight
Keeps 7 to 10 days in the fridge

title: Strawberry Salad
steps: Dissolve 2 pkg. strawberry Jello in 1 c. boiling water
Add 1 large can crushed pineapple
Add 3 mashed bananas
Add 1 c. chopped pecans
Add 1 to 2 c. sour cream
Pour half of the mixture into a pan and let set
Spread on cream
Add remaining Jello mixture

title: Chili Beef Casserole
steps: Cook 1 c. macaroni in boiling salted water until done (10 to 12 minutes) and drain thoroughly
Brown 3/4 lb. extra lean ground beef in a skillet
Add 1 can tomato soup and 1 can chili beef soup along with the macaroni
Heat 5 to 7 minutes stirring occasionally until bubbly
Cut 3 slices sharp processed American cheese diagonally
Place on top
Cover briefly to melt
Serve at once (serves 6)

title: Carrie's Cabbage Soup
steps: Combine all ingredients except ground beef or sausage.
Bring to a rolling boil.
Simmer about 3 hours.
Add ground beef or sausage in the last 20 minutes (optional)

title: Chicken And Pasta Salad
ingredients: 1 (8 oz.) pkg. egg noodles (cooked and drained)
steps: Combine cooked and drained egg noodles with chicken breasts cut into small pieces
Add green grapes and sliced almonds
Mix mayonnaise, Ranch dressing, creamy Italian dressing, and sugar to taste to form the dressing
Pour the dressing over the mixture
Toss the ingredients together

title: Ham Roll-Up
steps: Spread soft cream cheese over ham
Place a breadstick on each slice of ham
Roll up the ham

title: Penne Al’Arrabbiato
ingredients: Italian-style chopped tomatoes (2 cans, 14 oz. each)
steps: Bring water to a boil and cook pasta
Sauté garlic in olive oil briefly
Add tomatoes, parsley, red peppers, and salt to the skillet
Simmer until pasta is cooked
Toss sauce with drained pasta
Garnish with fresh parsley

title: Corn Casserole
steps: Mix all ingredients
Pour the mixture into a 2 to 3-quart casserole
Bake at 350° for 45 minutes

title: Vegetable Dip
steps: Mix mayonnaise, sour cream, chopped green onions, chopped green pepper, diced pimentos, Bac*Os, Tabasco, garlic powder or salt, and salt and pepper to taste
Refrigerate several hours or overnight
Keep well for about 2 weeks

title: Easy Chicken Pot Pie
steps: Lightly spray a 9 x 13-inch baking dish and line the bottom with approximately 2 c. cooked chicken cut into bite-size pieces
Mix 1 can Veg-All vegetables with 1 can cream of chicken soup, 1 can cream of onion soup, and 1 can cream of mushroom soup and spread over chicken
Mix 1 1/2 sticks melted butter or margarine with 1 c. milk and 1 1/2 c. flour and pour over the soup layer
Bake at 350° for 30 to 40 minutes until golden brown

title: Fruit Pizza
steps: Spread Pillsbury sugar cookie dough onto a baking sheet
Bake for 12 to 13 minutes at the temperature listed on the package
Cool completely
Loosen with a knife
Top with 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese mixed with 1/3 c. sugar
Decorate with fruit of your choice

title: Grasshopper Pie
steps: Crush 22 Oreo cookies
Mix crushed Oreo cookies with 1/4 c. margarine
Press mixture into a pie plate
Bake at 350° for 10 minutes
Cool completely
Fill cooled crust with a mixture of 1/4 c. creme de menthe, 1 (7 oz.) jar Marshmallow Fluff, and 1 pt. whipped cream

title: Squash Souffle
ingredients: 2 Tbsp. butter or Land O Lakes sweet cream spread
1 c. grated reduced fat Cheddar cheese
steps: Cook and mash 2 c. yellow squash with 2 Tbsp. butter or Land O Lakes sweet cream spread
Add 4 egg whites (well beaten)
Add 1 c. milk (1%)
Add salt and pepper
Add 1 c. Ritz cracker crumbs
Pour into a Pam-sprayed casserole
Top with 1 c. grated reduced fat Cheddar cheese
Bake at 350° for 30 to 45 minutes until firm
Serves 6 to 8

title: Loris’s Egg Salad
steps: Mash 6 hard-boiled eggs
Chop and add sweet gherkin pickle, chopped onion, and chopped green pepper
Stir in Miracle Whip
Add pimento (drained)
Add salt
Add a dash of paprika
Chill
Serve

title: Apple Kuchen
steps: Divide 1 recipe Basic Sweet Dough into 2 portions
Press into two buttered 8 x 8-inch pans
Press in 4 peeled and sliced apples (rounded side up)
Sprinkle with 1/2 c. sugar mixed with 1/2 tsp. cinnamon
Drizzle with 1/4 c. melted butter
Let rise until doubled
Bake at 350° for 40 to 50 minutes
Until golden
Serves 16

title: Eggplant-Tomato Casserole
steps: Peel and slice 1 small eggplant into 1/4-inch rounds
Peel and slice 4 tomatoes
Layer eggplant in a 2-quart casserole
Sprinkle with salt and pepper
Top with tomatoes
Sprinkle oregano flakes
Sprinkle some of the 1/4 c. grated Parmesan cheese
Repeat layers ending with cheese
Cover and bake at 400° for 30 to 40 minutes
Eggplant is tender

title: Strawberry Bread
steps: Combine dry ingredients separately
Mix wet ingredients
Stir wet ingredients into dry ingredients just until moistened
Add nuts if desired
Pour into greased loaf pans
Bake at 350° for 1 hour

title: Salsa
steps: Mix diced tomatoes, chopped green chilies, chopped green onions, finely diced celery, chopped yellow onions, chopped cilantro or parsley, tomato sauce, cumin, garlic, salt, and pepper.
Chill for 1 hour before serving.
Stir well before serving.

title: Meatball Stew
steps: Combine cornflakes cereal, egg, beef broth, salt, pepper, and ground beef. Form into meatballs.
Brown the meatballs in vegetable oil.
Add tomato soup, water, thyme, carrots, onion, white potatoes, and dried parsley flakes.
Simmer until vegetables are tender.

title: Cauliflower-Broccoli Casserole
steps: Simmer frozen cauliflower and broccoli until tender
Melt butter in a skillet
Add cream of mushroom soup, milk, and Velveeta cheese to skillet and cook until melted
Combine vegetables with cheese mixture and cooked rice
Bake the mixture uncovered at 350° for 30 minutes

title: Cabbage Casserole
steps: Sauté 1/2 c. chopped celery, 1/2 c. chopped bell pepper, and 1 small chopped onion in margarine
add 3 c. shredded cabbage and 1/4 c. water
cover and steam 5 to 6 minutes
remove from heat and stir in 1 c. cream of celery soup and pimento
transfer to a casserole dish
top with Pepperidge Farm herb stuffing mixed with butter
bake at 350° for 20 minutes

title: Best Ever Salad
steps: Cook 8 oz. fine spaghetti (or 7 oz. Mexican angel hair) and cool
Add 1/2 c. chopped onion, 1/2 c. chopped green pepper, 1/2 c. chopped celery, 2 c. chopped tomatoes, salt, pepper, and 1/4 tsp. curry
Stir in 1 can cream of celery soup and a small amount of mayonnaise if needed

title: Tuna Casserole
ingredients: 1 large box Kraft macaroni and cheese dinner
steps: Prepare 1 large box Kraft macaroni and cheese dinner according to package directions
cook and drain peas if frozen
sauté 3/4 c. celery and 1/2 c. onion and drain
combine with 1 large can tuna fish, 1 can cream of mushroom soup, 2 c. peas, 1/2 c. water, and salt and pepper to taste
bake at 350° for 35 minutes

title: Oatmeal Pie (Cheap Pecan Pie)
steps: Cream 2 sticks margarine with 4 eggs
Add 3/4 c. uncooked quick oatmeal
Add 1 1/4 c. dark Karo syrup
Add 1 1/4 c. white sugar
Add 3/4 c. coconut
Add 2 tsp. vanilla
Pour into 2 unbaked pie shells
Bake at 325° for 1 hour

title: Swiss Chicken Casserole
ingredients: 2 c. Pepperidge Farm herb stuffing mix
steps: Arrange chicken breast halves in a lightly greased 12 x 8 x 2-inch baking dish
Top each chicken breast half with a 4 x 4-inch slice of Swiss cheese
Mix cream chicken soup with 1/4 c. milk and spoon over chicken
Sprinkle with 2 c. Pepperidge Farm herb stuffing mix
Drizzle with 1/4 c. melted margarine
Cover and bake at 350° for 50 minutes
Yields 6 servings

title: Happy Face Cookies
steps: Mix butter with sugar
Add eggs and water
Blend in flour, baking powder, salt, vanilla, and powdered milk
Roll out dough
Cut shapes
Bake at 350°

title: No Bake Cookies
steps: Melt 1 pkg. almond bark according to package directions
Stir in 2 c. miniature marshmallows
Stir in 2 c. salted peanuts
Stir in 2 c. Rice Krispies
Stir in 2 c. Cap’n Crunch
Drop and shape on waxed paper

title: Slinky (Apple Flavored, Low Calorie Quencher)
steps: Pour 2/3 c. sparkling mineral water and 2/3 c. unsweetened apple juice into a glass
Stir in 1 Tbsp. freshly squeezed lemon juice
Garnish with a few apple slices and a sprig of mint

title: Peach Cobbler
steps: Melt 1 stick butter in a baking dish
Sift together 1 c. flour and 1 c. sugar
Stir in 2 c. milk to form a batter
Pour the batter into the melted butter
Add 2 c. fresh peaches on top without stirring
Bake at 350° for 40 to 45 minutes

title: Green Bean Specialty
steps: Heat and drain 2 cans green beans
Mix 4 Tbsp. bacon grease, 4 Tbsp. brown sugar, 4 Tbsp. vinegar, and 2 Tbsp. military
Heat the mixture
Pour the mixture over beans
Top with 4 pieces cooked and crumbled bacon
Serve hot

title: Raspberry Nut Perfection
ingredients: 1 (1 lb. 6 oz.) can red raspberry pie filling
steps: Spread 1 (1 lb. 6 oz.) can red raspberry pie filling in an 8-inch square pan
Mix 1/2 pkg. white cake mix with 1/3 c. water and 1 egg
Pour the mixture over the filling
Sprinkle with 1/2 c. flaked coconut and 1/2 c. chopped pecans
Drizzle with 1/2 c. melted butter
Bake at 350° for 40 minutes
Serve warm

title: Mexican Chicken
steps: Boil 1 whole chicken in water
Cool and cut into pieces
Place chicken in a 9 x 13-inch dish
Layer with 1 chopped onion
Layer with 1/2 lb. cheese
Layer with 1/2 bag taco-flavored Doritos (crushed)
Top with 1 can cream of chicken soup
Top with 1 can cream of mushroom soup
Top with 1 can Ro-Tel

title: 10 Minute Peanut Brittle
steps: Mix 1 c. sugar, 1/2 c. light corn syrup, and 1/4 tsp. salt in a 2-quart casserole.
Microwave the mixture on High for 5 minutes.
Stir in 1 to 1 1/2 c. raw peanuts.
Microwave for 2 to 6 minutes, stirring every 2 minutes until lightly browned.
Stir in 1 Tbsp. butter or margarine, 1 tsp. vanilla, and 1 tsp. soda until foamy.
Spread 1/4-inch thick on a well-buttered cookie sheet.
Cool, and break into pieces.

title: Onion Dressing
steps: Shake together in a covered jar
Add 1 (14 oz.) can evaporated skim milk
Add 1/2 c. vinegar
Add 1 envelope onion soup mix
Add 1/3 c. catsup
Add 1/2 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
Add 1/4 tsp. red pepper sauce
Shake until well combined
Store in refrigerator

title: Chocolate Oatmeal Cookies
steps: Melt 1 stick margarine in a saucepan
Add 1/2 c. milk, 1/2 c. cocoa, and 2 c. sugar and boil for 1 minute
Remove from heat and stir in 3/4 c. peanut butter until smooth
Add 1 tsp. vanilla
Add 3 c. oats and 1/4 c. nuts if desired
Drop quickly by teaspoonfuls onto waxed paper

title: Pastry Crunch
steps: Melt 1 (24 oz.) vanilla flavored candy coating in the microwave according to package directions
Stir in 3 c. corn and rice cereal, 2 c. chow mein noodles, 2 c. small pretzel twists, 2 c. peanuts, and 1 c. pecan pieces
Spread the mixture on wax paper to cool
Break into pieces
Store in an airtight container

title: Coconut Cream Pie (Low Calorie)
steps: Mix 2 boxes sugar-free instant vanilla pudding with 3 c. low-fat milk
Stir in 1 c. coconut
Pour into 1 baked pie crust
Top with 4 oz. Cool Whip (lite)
Sprinkle with toasted coconut
Refrigerate

title: Voodoo Chicken
steps: Mix white vinegar, soy sauce, sliced onion, garlic, and black pepper.
Add chicken pieces and marinate overnight.
Remove chicken.
Coat chicken with a mixture of Dijon mustard and ketchup.
Bake skin-side down at 350° for 30 minutes.
Turn chicken.
Mix remaining mustard and ketchup with milk and remaining marinade.
Pour over chicken.
Bake another 45 minutes (total baking time 1 hour 15 minutes)
Serve over rice.

title: Old Fashioned Tea Cakes
steps: Cream 1 c. butter with 2 c. sugar
Add 4 eggs one at a time
Mix in 1 Tbsp. milk
Add 1 tsp. nutmeg
Add 1 tsp. vanilla
Sift together 4 c. flour and 3 Tbsp. baking powder
Combine sifted flour mixture with the mixture
Add enough extra flour to roll and cut
Bake on ungreased cookie sheets at 325° for 15 minutes
Yields about 4 dozen

title: French Toast And Sauce
steps: Beat together 4 eggs, 1/2 c. milk, 1/2 c. thawed frozen lemonade, and 1/4 tsp. salt
Melt 1 Tbsp. of the 8 Tbsp. butter in a skillet for each slice
Dip 8 slices day-old bread in the egg mixture
Cook until browned on both sides
Serve with sauce as directed

title: Baked Corn
steps: Mix all ingredients
Bake at 350° for 1 hour

title: Chicken Casserole
steps: Mix diced cooked chicken, chopped celery, cooked rice, cream of chicken soup, mayonnaise, chopped pecans, melted butter, and diced onion in a buttered casserole
Sprinkle grated cheese on top
Bake at 350° until bubbly
At least 1 hour (serves 4 to 6)

title: Favorite Chocolate Cake
steps: Sift together flour, baking powder, salt, soda, and cocoa
Add sugar, eggs, red food coloring, shortening, and buttermilk
Beat with an electric mixer for 2 minutes
Pour into greased and floured pans
Bake at 350° for 30 minutes (tube pan about 40 minutes)

title: Blue Muffins
steps: Mix egg, milk, melted shortening, sugar, flour, and blueberries thoroughly
Pour into muffin pans
Bake at 350°

title: Devil's Chicken (Pollo Alla Diavola)
steps: Cut open 1 (3 to 4 lb.) chicken by removing the backbone and flattening
Mix 1/2 c. olive oil, 2 Tbsp. hot pepper sauce, juice of 2 lemons, ground pepper to taste, and 1 tsp. salt
Marinate the chicken for 2 hours
Cook as directed

title: Friendship Tea
steps: Mix instant tea, Tang, Wyler’s lemonade mix, cinnamon, and sugar.
Use 3 heaping tablespoonfuls per cup of hot water.

title: Heath Bar Pie
steps: Mix 3 finely chopped Heath bars with 1 medium container whipping topping
Pour into 1 graham cracker pie crust
Top with chocolate curls or chopped nuts
Refrigerate

title: Victorian Baked French Toast
steps: Cook 1 c. brown sugar, 1/3 c. butter, and 2 Tbsp. light corn syrup until melted
Pour into a 9 x 13-inch pan
Arrange 8 slices French bread on top
Mix 5 eggs with 1 1/2 c. milk and 1 tsp. cinnamon
Pour over bread
Refrigerate overnight if desired
Bake at 350° for 30 minutes until lightly browned

title: Quick Swedish Meatballs
steps: Mix ground beef, soft bread crumbs, cream cheese, dry onion soup mix, salt, nutmeg, and 1/4 c. of the 1 1/2 c. milk.
Form the mixture into balls.
Brown the meatballs lightly.
Place the browned meatballs in a baking dish.
Blend the remaining milk with stroganoff sauce mix.
Cook the mixture until it thickens.
Pour the thickened sauce over the meatballs.
Bake at 350° for 30 to 45 minutes.

title: Irish Stew (Microwave)
steps: Combine lamb cubes, 1 1/4 c. water, onion soup mix, and bay leaf in a 4-quart casserole.
Microwave covered on High 7 to 8 minutes.
Cook on power level 3 for 35 to 40 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add carrots and cook 15 minutes more.
Add baked potatoes cubed.
Blend 1/4 c. flour with remaining water.
Stir in.
Microwave 5 minutes until thickened.

title: Peach Salad
steps: Dissolve Peach Jello in 2/3 c. hot water with 1/2 c. sugar
Bring to a boil
Remove from heat
Add 1 large jar Peach baby food and 1 large can crushed pineapple (not drained)
Mix in 1 can condensed milk
Mix in 1 (8 oz.) pkg. softened cream cheese

title: Hidden Valley Ranch Oyster Crackers
ingredients: 1 pkg. Hidden Valley Ranch salad dressing mix
steps: Mix Hidden Valley Ranch salad dressing mix with 3/4 to 1 c. salad oil
Add 1/4 tsp. lemon pepper, 1/2 to 1 tsp. dill weed, and 1/4 tsp. garlic powder
Pour over 12 to 16 oz. plain oyster crackers and stir to coat
Warm in a very low oven for 15 to 20 minutes
